oNymu4DLcFF5yVoZ6VC0UA.text: My wife and I were in the UK visiting family and we were down in London looking for traditional fish n chips.  we were exploring the area, and I asked a passerby where really good fish n chips were.   OMG the flavor and taste brought back the memories when I was a kid.   They even used paper to put our chips in.   Extremely friendly staff, it was great talking to them.  Definitely the best fish n chips on our visit and we went to a lot of places!

XJ5eug_RTxfFyyAh08LI7g.text: The Skinny: Fast service, good food and a good variety. Location is a plus, too since it's only a few blocks from the Westminster Abbey.The Fat: Just look at the menu. The food is inexpensive, service is pretty good. You ask for it, you'll get it. No BS here, just order and eat...be happy!I'm an American and I recommend this joint! My friends from Hampstead Heath would get cravings and would take the tube just to get some Laughs from the Halibut. Warning: Don't bring an army in the place, they have limited seating because they are very busy.

axwHxTCxwRSoCbnFf3kuXw.text: This is a top notch old school fish & chip shop (surprisingly hard to find in London) much loved by the folk who have the good fortune to live or work in the area.It's very popular for a take away at lunch time with queues out the door most of the time but don't let that put you off  these guys are quick and efficient so you will rarely wait more than 10 minutes for your fishy feast. If you don't fancy eating fish & chips in the street, the nearby park or at a desk in the office there is a sit down option in the restaurant at the back of the shop which has plenty of seating (walk in past the queue outside and you will be found somewhere to perch).The fish is fresh and has plenty of flavour. The crisp golden batter keeps it nice and moist and when teamed up with a small portion of perfectly cooked chips this is a British classic which will leave you stuffed and well satisfied for under £7 (if you are not famished a portion between two might suffice). I'm a haddock man myself but if you want something a little more adventurous there is skate and calamari on the menu as well as an array of chicken, burgers, sausages and pies.If you are hungry in the Westminster area and fancy a taste of quality traditional British street food then you could do a lot worse than join the queue at The Laughing Halibut.

rHFgbTJbwwcwiya-NGt_BQ.text: Make no mistake this is not only the best fish and chip shop in Westminster but probably the whole of London! My recommendation is Haddock and chips.

CHHy8CYS4r1ZstRtZHSb_A.text: We loved the name and decided to try this place!The Fish and Chips were crisp and fresh.  We ordered in and had our plates about two minutes later.  The portions were huge--and we only got a half size. It's obviously a very popular and busy place, but we had no trouble getting in and getting a table.

2HxrwQbv50dAeGhlnNi_5g.text: If you love fish  please avoid this old school awful restaurant. The food is plain and on my visit it was over cooked, maybe even fried twice. I was so disappointed I wanted to get up and cook my own food. I am a terrible cook but I think I can teach these old dogs some new tricks.

c6jN_Mk2a49S0518S0iT9A.text: Generous chip amount. Great haddock and cod.   Do it up right with curry sauce.  Only downside is that they are not licensed, so no pint with your meal.

37kJGQSqfrpNbq0DWHGM9A.text: These are by far the best chips in the Victoia area! The prices aren't too bad either They also do curry sauce which makes a northern lass very happy! I was a bit gutted when i saw that they had left the skin on the fish - put me off the fish.

FVGcDrDOPq6NuF8yCPakhw.text: The wait staff was friendly, the cod and chips were delicious (great batter), and the atmosphere was casual. Great little place to eat fish and chips. My only complaint is that they don't make their own tartar sauce.

YeIgru6QSCTj08fMb8hIGQ.text: I love the chips here. Fat and chunky, served piping hot and there is always a long queue, rain or shine, because they are just the right consistency and texture for a chip. They are really generous and they don't mind when you stand there for about ten minutes soaking your chips in malt vinegar, which is the way forward really. Staff are friendly and you get served quickly too. This is a real fish and chip shop, where they don't sell the crispy scraps and rebrand them as a snack which some upmarket chippies are wont to do, you get those for free, just like in the good old days.

C3mVb8WNMtW4FvOKufh_mg.text: Went here for lunch, had the haddock and chips.  Service was quick, friendly and the food came fresh out of the fryer, so fast out of the fryer it was still scorching hot.  Threw some lemon and tartar on it, it was awesome.  Lots of locals in there so you know it's good.  Best Fish and chips thus far on my trip.

wOzazGCjgq-iNT5TsepWNQ.text: We wanted to get some fish and chips while in London so we went here and they were amazing! Fair prices, large portions, and good variety too. Definitely recommend.

OtO7H5J-wEHd-zYxvSpTrw.text: The best fish and chips establishment near work.  I don't go there often however when I do I am never disappointed.  It keeps you full for hours and the value for money aspect is amazing! I got 5 pieces of small fish, chips, drink and a sausage in batter all for less than £8!! The queue is always out the door on a Friday so if you are happy to visit during the week apart from Friday do so! You will not be disappointed! Furthermore dining in the staff are very attentive and provide a service that you cannot fault.

lHIubprMTMQQfMiMS2-kEA.text: As tourists from NYC and TX, I'll give the cod 5 stars and the halibut 3 stars. The halibut was dry and overlooked. The waitress said the portions weren't big and we wouldn't be charged the large dish but we were so be warned travelers. Enjoy.

le4pBpS6S00X-ui65Uap3g.text: An unexpected great find. We were in search for a local fish and chips joint in the area of Westminster. We were lucky enough to stumble upon the Laughing Halibut. The name itself caught our attention. The distinct smell of fried chips filled the street. We knew we were in the right place. The establishment was simple and functional. The free WiFi was a very nice touch. We ordered the standard fish and chips and coca-cola. Our drinks arrived chilled without any ice in a large glass. The fish and chips followed shortly. The serving portions were spot on. The chips was perfectly fried and the fish was a nice balance of crispy and soft. The table had the standard tartar sauce, HP sauce, and packets of ketchup. The meal was reasonably priced at £19.10 for two fish and chips with cokes. I will definitely pay this place a visit again when I return to London.

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips.

NODRbhjxDwkJFbKR9AZNjg.text: Came here with friends on our first day in London because we were craving fish and chips and this place did not disappoint! We ordered a large portion of cod and chips; a mixes platter of scampi, calamari, cod pieces, onion rings, and chips; and a liver and steak pie with chips split between the three of us which is a crazy amount of food given how large their portions are but it was well with it. The fish was delicately battered and fried leaving the exterior perfectly crispy and light and not at all overly greasy. Definitely a go to for fish and chips if you're in London!

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. Mixed platter with scampi, cod, calamari, chips and onion rings; liver and steak pie with chips; and large portion of cod and chips

qKJaguVOa5f8EvRhvOmwZw.text: Good spot for fish and chips. I went between haddock, cod, or the halibut and chose haddock based on recommendations from the server. Their speciality is the halibut but that tends to have a stronger taste. The haddock was delicious, fried perfectly and very flakey. The chips are good as we'll, not greasy which is a huge plus coming from the US. Dined for dinner and did not have to wait. Other reviews say the establishment gets really packed for lunch.Note: your clothes will have a strong oder after leaving

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. Haddock and chips

8WhuC9i6DG-GBnJc0C5OnA.text: Food: We had the fish and chips. I had the cod and my husband had the halibut. The cod was decent and very light. The halibut seemed a bit heavier and had a bit more harsh of a taste than the cod. Neither fish had much flavor nor did the chips. The vinegar was not very vinegary either.Service: The staff was nice enough. Price: I think the price was ok considering the quality. Of course I would have liked to have paid less but I think for London and the portion size the price was fair.Overall: We probably wouldn't go back as we found alternate restaurants that had better fish and chips.

KgjxziqStReMDmmgpCkJkw.text: Southern fried chicken and chips is delicious.  My husband got the cod and chips and said it was ok.

ia0zyDO4wV7ZW4NUj9lHSg.text: Laughing Halibut is a must visit for fish and chips. It's not too far off the beaten path for tourists, and you will definitely see a bunch of locals dropping by for a quick lunch. When I visited, there was a line out the door, but the staff moved quickly. They do have a sit down area, but the to-go is what most people do. The fish options are dependent on the day. They were out of halibut so I got cod which was terrific. For London, I got a huge portion for a very reasonable price. It was all made fresh, and the staff was quick and efficient taking my order and money. I would recommend most people sharing a full order. It truly is quite large. The chips/fries/whatever were quite meh. They got soggy rather quickly and they were under-seasoned. The fish itself was very well breaded and the salt and vinegar was perfect despite just being sort of tossed on. I will note that because it is so freshly made, it is hot. I wish I could have just let it sit and cool for awhile, but I was in a hurry at the time. Also, it's a bit hard to eat. It's all in a paper bag and greasy as hell. Of course, that is to be expected, but just be aware to get some napkins or utensils. There is a park just down around the corner where a bunch of business men and I sat down to munch down on our meals. The food definitely attracted some pigeons, and I was glad that I had wet wipes for cleanup. Overall, I would say this is a great stop for anybody. It's not the best meal in the world, but so far as cheap good food, it's hard to beat. Just watch your cholesterol.

qs97Qifa2MlHcN8WE-KMBQ.text: Amazing fish and chips. Not very large portions of fish (plenty of chips tho). But everything was fluffy and crispy.

MJxlfazSmsuHYkGgIuCFWw.text: I'm not into fish & chips, but I was determined to eat some while in England. This place's fish was so crisp and lightly breaded and hot and fresh and amazing... It was really really good, just as the reviews said. I'm glad I went here.And they have a huge menu, including grilled fish, which I'd love to try next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. Menu page 2
Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. Menu page 1

hK4iZWGWRYJmN02mA68jQA.text: Nothing special.  It's your average fried fish place. The fries were warm, but not hot and fresh.   The large portion was enough to split for two for lunch. The crust was crispy and the fish was flakey, but a bit oily.  Our party shared cod and halibut. The street out front, Strutton Ground, is a walking street closed to traffic that has lots of food tents.  Next time I'd get some fish and chips and walk around and sample some other fare.

CbqVNbZktqTXMRCQ706Txw.text: Quick, easy, like me out the door at 2 pm on a Thursday.  Family run, and great bite of fresh made fish and chips.

jeu6MhyWY5WaNZW_2jT4Ng.text: We were there just before the office lunch crowd arrived.  This is a small place with casual dining. We had the Halibut with chips for 16£, fried chicken 6.80£ and 2 cups of bland coffee with milk.  Halibut was on the dry side, Chicken was missing some flavoring.   Either we ordered the wrong dishes or the previous Yelp reviews were over rated.   I do not recommend this place.

gaxbvIWGr3JD9HJxaX4kKw.text: After visiting Westminster Abbey, we came to Laughing Halibut to get some fish and chips. My husband and I split a small portion of cod and chips and it was sufficient for the both of us.The fish came out freshly fried! My husband who normally doesn't like fish loved the cod here. Definitely a great place to grab fish and chips.

uuSlLGKco7xfKxaLpi-9sQ.text: A great place to eat at under £10!A no nonsense fish and chips place with a variety of choices of fish including cod, skate, halibut (duh), haddock, and plaice.The batter is really thin and light which does not interfere with the distinct taste of each type of fish.It's a really simple plate of fish and chips that you should try if you are around the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. Haddock Fish & Chips

_WjHpmumnxMNmSEA4JS7WA.text: What a disappointment, heard so many good thing and not to par. Arrived around 1130 and still a light crowd. Sat down and offered menus, all was pleasant at this time. We needed a little time to decide so waitress came back a bit later. I ordered the Halibut and my better half ordered Fried Chicken. Good came in about 10-15 minute, both needed seasoning and the chips were not hot. My fish still had he skin on, not sure if this was normal but made it awfully fishy. Also, she quietly dropped the check when we started to eat.  Waitress never came back to check and just ignored us as one time tourist. I stupidly paid the bill and left her a tip.  I should have eaten at the food stall set up on the street. Saw and smelled a lot of good food out there. If it weren't so cold out I would have and not gotten the cold treatment here.

Fo2jC0AleaErfAWDwoOAUg.text: I don't think the fish and chips were all the reviews cracked them up to be honestly. We had actually great service but I just didn't see why the reviews were so great for the fish and chips

7YsBMoAxg8PExolnr1CYLA.text: Fish and chips were fresh and a good portion. They weren't oily either which was a good surprise. Service was friendly and prompt. They don't have real malt vinegar for some odd reason.

rd47I3_DnYN4ZWm4mBhNaQ.text: Very good and fast service. Not too far from buckingham palace, Small place though, and it's really busy during lunch hours. The serve mainly fish and chips with different selection of fish. They also have chicken wings a few selection of bar food. I ordered cod and chips, it's a big portion and it's really good. My hubby ordered halibut and chips that's also very delicious. The chicken wings are okay though not as good as the fish and chips. I recommend this place to get your fish and chips crave fixed. And they have free wifi

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. The inside of the restaurant

rY6yDbkoDvp9VEPYXVZjxQ.text: (3.5) Came here after landing in London and we originally ordered the Halibut but turns out they were already sold outThe chips were pretty oily which is a disappointment since I love chips (fries). As for the fish we ended up getting the cod. The cod was cooked very well. Didn't taste fishy at all. Cod was overall decent but nothing to rave about. Tasted like it was missing something to it

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. Cod Fish and Chips ( Fries )

wL7Xu-f-3CBku129Ku8k1g.text: Delicious food! Get the cod and chips with a side of curry sauce and mushy peas. It's a small place but the service is fast and the portions are large. The prices are very reasonable too.

T8fAurNjls-W6LkO85oGWg.text: The food was pretty good and the environment was nice for my family consisting of two young, rowdy siblings. It wasn't the best fish and chips I've ever had, but I had to try some while I was in London, right?

MrfuWMVTjWzsKKWXPxPtog.text: In town with 4 kids on holiday and this was a god Send. Great quality take away and everyone loved it.

pA8zTCHYRwoHjd0vcbTb1g.text: AMAZING.I had the rock, chips and mashed peas. The mashed peas weren't too liquid and resembled mashed potatoes! It was savory, light and just freaking awesome.The guy recommended the rock as it had more of a fish taste. You honestly can't go wrong with any fish there. Thr chips were alright and they had a wide selection of sauces. Best fish and chips i've had since i've been here

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom

P8EkuW0tp27tyBm2j1ux-Q.text: Great little fish and chips place! Portions are huge! We got the Cod and Haddock to share, it was more than enough. The prices are fair and the service is good as well. The chips could have been better, a bit oily. Tartare sauce is in packets instead of fresh made.

siAR91wnhFk_lFG9uY7P9w.text: Traditional Fish and Chips.  A great fish lunch.  If you are looking for fancy, this isn't it.  Seems like a lot of locals go here.Exactly what we were looking for.

VtGE8FK4aJWEy2-2eVlqqQ.text: Best fish and chip shop we found on our visit. The bonus was the chicken wings, great flavor. Super friendly staff and the fish and chips were yummy.. Good price, and good amount of food.

PZExH4Iccgv22J4qJvsL7Q.text: Saw that this place had some good reviews and we wanted to try some Fish and Chips while we were in London as many of the other reviewers here did. As far as food goes, we got the Haddock and a Chicken and Mushroom Pie, both came with chips or fries to Americans. The Pie was pretty decent, the fish and chips were nothing to write home about. The only thing that made the fish and chips decent was the tartare sauce. Service was poor and inattentive. Only time they came around was to try to whisk away the plates before we were quite done with our chips.  Before entering, we asked to make sure if they take credit. The employee turned to who I thought was probably the manager or owner of the establishment who said yes, it works, but no American Express. He urged us to sit down and we immediately saw signs saying that they are not accepting credit because their machine is broken. We thought this was a bit weird, but figured not only did the employee ask a superior, they also specified which card would not be accepted.When it came time to pay, I pulled out a visa credit card, to which the waitress pointed to a sign saying they cant take credit. I replied that I checked before ordering and we were assured we could pay with credit. They asked the same manager who rolls his eyes before telling her to try to run the card, during which, unsurprisingly the machine fails to connect. I ended up having to go find an ATM to pay (something I was trying to avoid since I would only be in town shortly).  I would not waste my time here for the food for a second time and I certainly would recommend people stay away from here for the business practice alone. Don't knowingly force people into a situation they don't want to be in when they are trying to handle business in a considerate manner to begin with. As we left, the poor business ethics left a worse taste in our mouths than the food did.

kd5gwMLh69tdUdoqJKP46w.text: Fish and Chips!! Yeah, I had to have fish and chips during my time in London. I was sick and coughing, and that fried food did NOTHING to help me. I had the Halibut and chips, and it was good. I felt like the Halibut was a bit dry, but it was kinda flakey. I smothered it with tarter sauce to get it a bit more moist. I had a bite of my friends grilled fish, and that was super moist and good. The chips were also good and yum.  My friend and I both ordered a side of mushy peas...which. I still don't quite understand how Londoners like this stuff. Its okay, but was like...textured baby food. Was kinda meh for me.I did loved that this place was a mix of tourist and locals. Locals sat down and immediately ordered...tourists like me took a while to look up the foods.

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. A bit dry
Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. Halibut and chips with mushy peas

Pt-dxvmlvFhSnhMa7vFz6w.text: Really good! Went late near closing and the food was still fresh and tasty. Very authentic. Staff was very nice. Quick service and LARGE portion!!!

Muc_G9GtG9dm7LRHMZG0eg.text: For my first visit to England, Laughing Halibut definitely showed me how delicious fish and chips could be. There are so many different types of fish to choose from, and for the price, anything on the menu is an amazing deal. Especially looking at some of the other restaurants in London, the price point of the Laughing Halibut was so refreshing - anyone can get a deliciously filling meal for less than 10 pounds!Regular is definitely enough of a portion to fill a normal person's stomach, but if you feel like you have a monstrous appetite, go for the Large, and see if you can handle it. My whole family ordered the Regular size, and we wound up taking a lot of food back home. The fish just tasted so, so fresh. I've had some mediocre fish and chips back home in America, and it just does not compare at all. I adored my haddock - I definitely recommend the haddock if you're going for a traditional fish and chips meal. My dad had the cod, and it was a little drier and not as tasty in my opinion. I was worried that the chips would be too dry (because I looked at the Yelp photos beforehand), but I was very pleasantly surprised. The chips were crispy and not too oily and were a delightful accompaniment to my fish. I will say though that though the fish tastes fresh, it is coated with batter and deep fried to perfection. Obviously, if you're not into fried foods, this place would not be the place for you (but neither will any fish and chips place be ideal for you). Just at the Laughing Halibut in particular, you can definitely taste the oil and the crunch of the fried batter before you get to the fish. It was wonderful for me for the first few bites but got admittedly a little overwhelming as I was working my way through the dish.Service is super friendly as well. They joke around and made me and my family feel at home and welcome since they probably could spot that we were not from the area. Lots of other reviews mentioned that it would be crowded, but we came on a weekday evening an hour before closing time, and it was not crowded at all - plenty of room! I guess we just got lucky. Oh, and there's also free wi-fi, which is fantastic.I absolutely loved my trip to Laughing Halibut. I definitely recommend a visit here for anyone who wants a taste of what real fish and chips are all about.

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. MIXED PLATTER SPECIAL: scampi, onion rings, calamari, cod bits, chips
Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. Cod Bites
Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. Haddock

u5Ev5LrZbPnkF81kLnws3Q.text: If you're looking for the most down-to-Earth atmosphere and some really authentic fish & chips, the Laughing Halibut is the place. This no-frills eatery allows you to dine in or take out. Tried the halibut (of course) and it did not disappoint! Just the right amount of crispy fried crust surrounding a beautiful flaky white fish. The fish is locally sourced from Billingsgate Market, so you know it's excellent. They make everything to order, so it's fresh and piping hot when it comes to you. The thick-cut "chips" are great, especially when paired with the gravy. Their mushy peas are interesting, with a traditional creamy texture--definitely a must-try. Service is speedy and courteous.

p8xZOzHkdOxZOOTZSTkG7Q.text: I was very excited to go to The Laughing Halibut for some traditional/authentic fish and chips. I ordered the large combo platter along with a side salad and mushy peas to split. The food was... okay. I have had fried fish in restaurants in the United States, and this seemed particularly soggy and greasy, much more so than I am used to. The portions were decent, and the service was friendly, but the food was nothing worth writing home about.

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom

H42Cp7QJQ7sPmjPmetkVGQ.text: One of the best ever fish (and chips) I had in the world (perhaps 2nd after Blue Fin-Fish in Victoria, BC).Nice place, always full but with very little wait in line as the turn over is fast and service very efficient (and familial -- you will recognize the mom and daughter... or are they sisters?).Go for fish! again and again, huge portion, take more! I would go back for sure if I lived nearby... Chips are also surprisingly good!I don't get why some people go there for a sausage... but anyhow,,,

ZEKwd6tajJNq9EpXctaUpg.text: Loved it! Totally satisfied the need for legit English fish & chips.  Definitely be back! Haddock was my favorite (tried the cod & halibut too)!

GeEtinQWsmn7NZxKzY13-g.text: Decent fish and chips and reasonable prices.  Escape the London tax and high prices!  Fast and friendly.

BIuXwRAaGNCriS3nJp1tNQ.text: Incredible service and food. Ordered the halibut and chips with a side of mushy peas. All made to order and was very fresh. My wife and I split the dish. It was more than enough for us both. All condiments were on the table and consisted of malt vinegar, ketchup, mayonnaise, tarter sauce.  Highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. Delicious Halibut and chips with a side of mushy peas.

CaBLdiZuWUOiexFKEdppfw.text: Great taste and fair prices if you're looking for a traditional English fish & chips. Not far away from the center of London

ghrsMl3VWVXMfH5RECUn_Q.text: I had the jumbo sausage, it wasn't even cooked completely! My girlfriend ordered the cod and chips that was decent until we found a long hair in it! Yes "in" it, inside the battered crunchy part. Best thing I had was the calamari. Didn't give me any napkins had to ask for it, and didn't even refill my water, I had to ask for that as well! I came here because it was the number one thing that showed up on Yelp, and they were wrong about it, don't go!

LqI5mopRonJxaQ_Z_h4SVg.text: The Fish & Chips was the best I've ever had. When I ordered a large portion, the old timer waitress commented that I looked like I had a healthy appetite. I didn't disappoint her, I cleaned my plate. The fish was crispy, not too heavy and very large. The Chips were also crispy and stayed that way even after several rounds of malt and vinegar. I had a bottle of lemonade with my meal. We arrived at 12:30 pm and there was a queue or line out the door for take out. We walked past the queue and to to the back where there wasn't a wait for a table.

MSe4uO7cuFRfDK0cZReLOQ.text: So I knew I wanted to eat some fish and chips when I'm in London. After watching the changing of the guards I decided to eat lunch. Found this place on Yelp and decided to go here. Ordered the Cod with chips (fries for those that didn't know). Let's say this, the fish was excellent and if I would come back, I would only order the fish....Never would I order the chips again. It was warm, but it was stale and stale hard on the edges. The "waiting" service was very good though.

Bzh7Y8Itvl7_xbJMFI9oEw.text: Halibut was great and very flaky; cod was a little mushy. Skip the gravy, the fish doesn't need it. Skin is left on the fish in Great Britain, FYI. The chips were softer than I prefer, not crispy enough.

41FhqVTSEOSxQlF0QZBOxQ.text: Awesome fish and chips! I opted for the cod and it was great. Portion was large and flaky. Fresh and piping hot! Fries were good also. Ordered a regular portion which was huge! I should have split the portion with my hubby! Service was quick. No complaints at all.

wrjTx0OxFsyZFIOUJ_6t0Q.text: Came with my daughter who is allergic to everything. They know their fish and ingredients. She LOVED the cod and chips, as did I. Top notch, traditional fish and chips. A definite try in Westminster.

39dEJjND2WW0pM0buNXfEA.text: large portions, great food.  the cod roe is excellent.

JBFsnaNqBYiiEqobPxfOHQ.text: Very simple and perfectly executed fish and chips.  Crisp and crunchy, not greasy.  Even the Calamari was surprisingly tasty.

aPQbgqHFQAWIgv8FGvLkzA.text: Stumbled over this place while searching for a quick bite on our walking tour of London. Server was really friendly, and the fish and chips were authentic and delicious. Great atmosphere and vibe too!!

BdewuziIGSPZeGYXpzVq8w.text: very mediocre fish- but good chips. tartar sauce in packets ?? no lemon?? batter is not light - but heavy and oily. i've had better fish in California USAat least serve a decent tartar sauce!!!

lid6DOel87Gi1AUDvcDe4A.text: "Fish & chips" is an interesting cuisine option - it's almost universally invoked with a modicum of enthusiasm, and is very much regarded as an English cultural cornerstone - and though it's ostensibly a simple meal, there's definitely a huge variation in quality. One thing that's always puzzled me, in fact, is how people maintain their enthusiasm for fish & chips from their local chippy when it's obviously terrible. Having walked past The Laughing Halibut many-a lunchtime to see a queue stretching out the door and towards the corner of the street I was keen to give them a try and see what the fuss was about. With so many nice places to choose from in the immediate area, why on earth would you line up for 15 to 20 valuable minutes for a meal which flies in the face of popular health wisdom, with an eager look on your face!? Turns out - I discovered, making a special weekend trip in - it's because these guys really know their way around a piece of cod. Crispy golden battered fish sits amid a sizeable pile of chips which, once I'd gotten them back to the office, were suitably crunchy (without being crispy) and tasty as well! (My chip vocab is a little lacking) They weren't the sad anaemic looking excuses you sometimes discover next to your fish. Similarly, the fish was tasty, with just the right thickness & texture of batter, and - perhaps it was coincidence - not a single bone. The whole thing seemed quite well-priced for the amount of food you got - probably a serve of chips & 2 bits of cod could satisfy 2 people, and set you back somewhere in the region of 10 or 11 quid. There's other types of fish there, but I've not had the chance to get anywhere near the menu since that day, so you'll have to go find out yourself. There's a good reason why The Laughing Halibut's a local point of reference when giving directions - it's been there a good few years now, and judging by the following they've got it'll be there a few more yet.

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom

Gl6_G7iULNccfUnuWwH1Yw.text: If you are looking for atmosphere and a fancy room, this isn't your place. If you are looking for THE best fish -n- chips in London...then this is it. Huge portions. Friendly wait staff.  A must for any visitor to London.

J5Dp3EXtW8sGNspXMU73Ow.text: This spot is about 5 minutes walk from my short term flat in London, and I'm reasonably certain the main goal is to make me gain weight. I will be here nearly every day.It is a proper chip shop with all the accouterments one should expect (i.e. none). The food is fabulous in that deep-fried-I-want-to-kill-myself sort of way, well worth it.The chips are fantastic, though if you're American one must ask for vinegar (how do they know? Is it the accent?). The large chips are enough to feed about 8 people really, so consider that if you're getting anything other than chips. I had to toss about half the output of Ireland - McDonald's supersize has nothing on these chips.All in all, a big win for a nice little spot from which I will gorge myself time and time again.

lvbT6Hfclbup-CRgC4nqPQ.text: Solid fish and chips, the only things any reasonable person would order there. I had the haddock. Would definitely go again.

2kB6_sUsG9xDa8NUvtAGgg.text: Ordered the cod and it was excellent. Large size is definitely a large amount of food and priced very well. Waitstaff wasn't the most attentive but they were extremely quick with the food.

vZbx37qW7lDEOOULKLfN4w.text: So glad I checked yelp for local fish and chips by our hotel. It was the first time my husband ever tried fish and chips and mushy peas in London and this place did not disappoint. The haddock and cod did not disappoint. It was deliciously fresh, quick, and a great price. If you're in the area definitely grab a bite.

S9dQ9VUJtrBIMgLYQ4Wi8w.text: I'm not sure how to explain this. I guess I was expecting it to be more like a restaurant and less like a lunch counter. But when I looked at the picture, I should have known.Of course I ordered the Fish & Chips. They have many types...first time I have ever seen that. They give a big piece of fish but the chips are not crisp (I'm finding that must be the norm in England).The help is friendly. Their credit card machine was not working. Not sure if it ever really is. When I got change, not all the coins were English. They gave me a Czech coin that looked very close to a British Pound. I'm sure most tourist would not have been able to tell.If you don't drink beer than this is probably a good place for you, if you do drink beer, go to a pub.

SvNn_RUl5PSi6lMLIMfZAA.text: We arrived early, around 1130 as I read that it tends to be crowded around lunch. We were the only ones there dining in but there was a steady stream of take outs. The service was really nice, the waitress was patient with us and explained the different type of fishes. We ended up getting the cod and paddock. The servings were pretty generous in my opinion. It was our first meal of the day and we ended up eating the fish but was unable to finish the fries. The cod was delicious, tender and juicy. The paddock was a different type of fish, a bit more dry and fishy than cod but not bad if you like that type of fish. Prices were reasonable as well. I picked it due to its location, close to Buckingham and Westminister Abbey and didn't regret it. I would recommend to others.

yw_v1jKZ-NV3xoJPgdLlmQ.text: Came in with wife and 2 small kids. Good, tasty food at reasonable prices, big portions.

Kf8Oazqgaj6QcSq-jXxFXw.text: You know it's good when there's still a line for lunch (and for take away) at 1:30pm on a weekday afternoon.  I think we were the only Americans here, too -- which is a plus when looking for a place like this.  Located 2 blocks from Westminister Abbey and 1 block from St James tube, this is a hidden gem (hidden from the guidebooks, that is) and really worth seeking out when you are weary from your tourist treks.  There are several types of fish on the menu.  We each had the cod, which was mild, and fried to crispy perfection.  (I'm drooling as I write this.)  I had the "small" portion which was a giant fillet (not a scrap) and my bf had the "large" fillet (which was truly giant).  The chips are about 1cm square in profile (chunky!) and were served piping hot.  The ginger beer is something to write home about -- really gingery and a little bit sweet.  Service was pretty good too!  Speedy and no nonsense.  We probably waited just 5 minutes for our food after ordering.

xQjHBtdQnjG1Iejs8XEQ2Q.text: Food was okay, large portion, average taste, cheap price. Free super-fast internet in the restaurant.

bzAn7nNjs4Xg2Kdhdzmyxw.text: A good and simple place to get a quick bite to eat! There was a line out the door but we quickly realized it was a to-go line while there is some seating in the restaurant. The workers were extremely nice and helpful. Would definitely go again! I didn't give it five starts mainly because it was simple in ambience and decoration. But other than that a perfect place for a quick meal!

OFqW7clqgnaUX3qAZSWU9g.text: Not from the UK and I'm not really sure what makes "good" fish and chips but I enjoyed my meal. I ordered the haddock and chips. The price isn't too bad and the service is fine. The fish itself was crispy but not exactly too tasteful and the sauces didn't really help, but like I said before I'm not too familiar with tradition. The chips were good as well but what would've been nice to have is more tartar sauce that didn't come from various packets.

9m_M3QeSuZCeUSMPsz_mVg.text: Nice simple "fish n chips" place no frills. It was just a solid good piece of cod and chips.. and I added side gravey for french frys I meen Chips... stuffed on the small piece. ..

-EXMwI6DM_pnxGYY_oDEWA.text: This was my first time having fish and chips and I am so happy I tried it here first. The cod was so delicious. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a good casual easy place!

oDekI-pqdMddE1NdKqFHCw.text: I couldn't leave London without getting myself an order of fish and chips. Based on the reviews, the Laughing Halibut seems like the right place. Right when you walk in there is a to-go counter and once you walk further, there are dine-in options. They have a variety of different fishes you can choose from and I chose the fish and chips, haddock version. The fish was delicious, flakey, and the crust was not as dried and thick as most fish and chips spots that I've tried. I also could not stop eating the fries. I was able to finish my whole meal and wanted another (however, I had to stop myself).My only complaint would be with the surge of tourists visiting this joint, I could tell that the waiters was not too keen on serving us. I wish there was more hospitality in their service or at least made me feel a little more welcomed. Would I come here again? Probably not. I would like to try different places as well as enjoy better service like the other places I've been in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. Haddock and chips

14mDJ-SmxLP9RBitrWY_Tg.text: Confession: decided to pick this place after learning this was David Miliband's fave chippie shop.Fish n chips is not my thing, but succumbed for it in London from peer(partner's) pressure. But this friendly, clean, complimentary wifi offering establishment gave me a good intro to this dish according to my dining companion n lover of this dish.My sense was that the ambience was fairly dignified n clean for a fish n chips place:p

o63JC2zWg2PdLUXlNI_Bfw.text: Fantastic! The best fish and chips in the U.K. Tried lots of places but this one was by far the very best. We were looking for some fish and chips before going to see the play Wicked and this was fast, friendly and simply perfect! Delicious! We will definitely be returning!

pDTFwWXf_FXRRyn9pLaSyw.text: A quick stop for some Fish and Chips. Being in London, we had to be the ultimate tourists and get a plate of fish and chips. We quickly sat down and got the Halibut and chips. The halibut was well fried, crispy on the outside, moist on the inside. The portion size can definitely be split between two people if you don't want to leave overly full. The fries were also good, typical of what to expect from Chips. They accept credit card and you pay as you leave. I noticed the cod and chips when we left and that was a gigantic portion, even bigger than the halibut. Looked like everyone was quite enjoying their fish.

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. Halibut and chips

E8z-JOhwwe_pumE9y2Rz3g.text: It is not very nice inside. The fish options were tasty, but their pies were not the best. They were too dry and kind of stale and the whole experience was kind of meh. I was disappointed to see it so highly rated. Service was also kind of meh. They don't really have great sauce options, either.

XMtI4XxW5ijYahA2JwmLXA.text: Excellent cod and chips with mushy peas.  I would definitely return well worth the visit they were delicious.

-o1P8FH1LTj3_DqVrj37og.text: Not that great sadly. I've had a lot of fish and chips in the states that were better than the Laughing Halibut. While the batter was light and crispy, I thought the fish was dry and tasteless. I thought the fried calamari was actually better and the service barely cared we were there.Tip: You can't put tip on your credit card. It was our first stop when we got to London and we had no clue!

uG9_IW4NOCQzetsuYrbq-A.text: This is a nice place to stop for a quick bite of classic fish and chips. The cod was very good; crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. The French fries were good but nothing special. Service was friendly and quick

R6dOZ4PdXwNoWx_-x9y53Q.text: Definitely had better fish and chips back in US. The fish was bland. Had to use a lot of tartar sauce. They do however give you a big portion and offer a lot of condiments. But overall I was not really impressed.

Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. Menu

8uyKyEVb_mNTkyzRk6UbNw.text: Ventured in during a walk-tour day of London.  Traditional chip shop with no pretension or fanciness,...just a guy with a fryer doing his thing.The cod and haddock were perfectly fried, not too greasy (as well as the chips) with plenty of malt vinegar available. The mushy peas were very creamy with a traditional flavor.  Not much else to say, would definitely return if in the area.

Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. Menu

IdBC65KAirJ_L6ZIe2MQ5Q.text: Excellent take away fish & chips. Nothing to hide, just good fried halibut or cod and some damn good chips.

HllGLhgTHtXGstE5ob1Qmw.text: The fish and chips here were good, but they still can't compare to a place that I ate at in San Francisco. Also, the price was a little bit high for my liking considering the quality of the food you get. The quantity was decent and there was quite a lot of fish, but I overall didn't find the flavors to be that great and the meal felt relatively heavy.Also note: I have a very high standard for fish and chips because I've gotten it so many times from so many places. For a place in London, I was expecting a bit better, but it definitely wasn't a bad meal by any means. I'd probably just look for a place that can offer you fish and chips for a little bit cheaper.

490PPJC21GTigdn4QJPflg.text: Nothing fancy about this place but does that matter, Its good tasting fish and chips , stick with the Hailbut. Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom

ReJOby8k23qTvIX-9hWs5Q.text: The best fish and chips that I had in London out of around 3 or 4 other highly ranked spots.  I stopped in at lunch time and was impressed by how streamlined their process is.  I was in and out within 5 minutes with fresh, hot fish and chips covered in vinegar and with some ketchup packets on the side.I took my huge greasy bag to a local park and sat down to eat it.  The fish was perfect.  Excellent batter with flaky fall apart fish on the inside.  I loved every bite of it.  Some tartar sauce to dip it in would have been nice though; I didn't see any at the restaurant.The chips were good, no complaints there.  They were softer, which I prefer over more crispy.There was a ton of fish and a ton of chips...very much worth the price.  The price wasn't very high at all either.Overall this was my favorite spot for fish and chips in London.  Next time I'm in town I'll be stopping by here first thing!

Z7Z46nnMM3-y1rhVFB9e3A.text: This was our first meal on our Worldtrip 2015 Honeymoon! Flying from Hawaii to London was lengthy, so we were looking for a place that served up authentic and tasty London yums to curb the jet lag. For the record, I am no fish-n-chips officiant, and I have only been to London one other time before this back in 2011. So to find a good restaurant in the middle of the bustling city, I used none other than my trusty Yelp app and sought out TLH just a couple blocks away from us! The restaurant was easy to find on the map, but it is a small eatery so keep your eyes open! The dining room can probably fit no more than ten tables, but the areas are clean. The restaurant is operated by a very nice family! I was able to meet the father, son and daughter and chat with them for a bit. Turns out they spoke Turkish and started their restaurant in London in hopes of a better life.Our group of four tried the haddock and halibut. Both fish were tasty-- the haddock was flaky and the halibut was moist. The batter was nice on both fish; not too oily or thick so the flavor of the fish meat was well received. Portion sizes are good and even the big boys got full off their meal! For what it's worth, I enjoyed TLH and the service we received from the staff. Thank You for starting our journey off on the right foot!

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. Cod, haddock and halibut fish and chips! Best in London!

SKC5S6m4zOjgikI1mqS52A.text: Recommended to us by the hotel staff at Conrad St James and it was a short walk away and it is the best halibut I have ever had. Thick and fried very well, definitely hearty. The stars are strictly for the halibut. Being American we over season everything and they don't really season in Europe so the fries were bland. But just for the halibut alone it's worth the visit here for sure. My wife had the southern chicken and said it was pretty good and had a little kick to it. Get the halibut!

LU7r-cElufReLfgkZSwtSg.text: Great fish n chips spot! Kind of a hole in the wall, which I really liked. Service is quick and great. The food is super crispy (I got the cod n chips) and is some of the best fish n chips I've had out here. I'll be back next time I'm town for sure! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom

MR9KzFvZz9p4b3Yr_X1pJA.text: Needed to try some local fish and chips before leaving London. Looked up fish and chips around my hotel and found this lovely neighborhood spot. The prices are fair and the portions are huge. The service was lovely as well. As for the food itself, the fish is a little bland, but they have a lot of sauces to spice the fish up. The chips were delicious.It's nice to see that locals actually eat here -- the place fills up during lunch time.

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom

klD4g7dD84FVane-Kgb4PA.text: Great staff, came there on vacation with the fam. Huge portions, crisp, fried to order. Wish they were in the US

m5OYcCWgy1Q8BJovmzeKKQ.text: Dang, reading the other reviews doesn't give this place justice.  So many tourists getting fish and chips just cause it's the thing to do.  I think you should get fish and chips cause that's what you want to eat.For me, I LOVE fish and chips and I've have it as often.  And this place, is probably tops in my book.  The fish is a big filet and it's good size portion.  I normally eat it with tartar sauce and a bit of vinegar but the fish here was so good, I just ate it without any sauce.  The chips, were well done and crispy.These guys know what they are doing and they do it well.So if you want get blown away by fish and chips, good luck with that.Go look for some funky fusion tapas place with all the hipsters and foodies.  But if you're looking for quality fish and chips, and love fish and chips, this place won't disappoint.

9yK2UqorHnFkTgrZahMXyQ.text: ~3.5 starsWhen in London, its a MUST to get in touch with tradition and eat some fish & chips. I don't have a lot of compare to, but this place seems pretty decent.Located on an alleyway with several food stands, this place is very casual. You walk in, sit down, order a fish dish off their menu. Very simple. Friendly workers too.We ordered the large halibut & chips for 15 euro...a tad pricey, however, the piece of fish was humongous....one order was able to make 2 people content, especially with the amount of freshly cut chips (fries) they supplied. The fresh and flaky chunk of fish came with tartar sauce, but I opted for ranch instead. Batter was light & crispy...not too thick at all. Oh yes, they were also nice enough to find me a huge bottle of the ranch which I kept all to myself for the duration of my meal ;) BTW they take credit cards!

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. They gave us this HUGE jug of ranch
Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. Large halibut~

HmpeO2CjgPgUad3nYNCGYQ.text: Stumbled on this place while walking in the area and was pleasantly surprised. The restaurant itself is small and had a "hole-in-the-wall" kind of vibe. I ordered the haddock and chips to eat. The fries were crispy but a bit plain- not too much flavor to them. The haddock had a great coating, very crispy and tasty, and the inside was flaky and cooked perfectly. The portions were generous and the prices were fair. Service was friendly and quick. If you're looking for your fish and chips fix in London, give this place a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. Decent sized portion

36dc01nsWGECAUfUczQKtg.text: What a quaint and wonderful little restaurant!  When we arrived they had a problem and were having to fix it.  Weren't really specific, but couldn't open for about an hour.  When we came back we were seated in a corner next to a large racous group.  However, it was worth it.  We had the cod and chips and it was delightful and we all loved it.  Large portions and wonderful fresh chips.  It was pretty greasy, but it still had a good robust flavor.  A guy pushed past us with a big blue bin of recently cut chips, so you know it is fresh.  We loved the staff who were very attentive.  The only flaw I found was the malt vinegar needed to be fresher/stronger.  It was very weak, which I didn't expect at a true fish and chips place like this.  I hope they will fix this in the future, because that can really enhance the fish.

Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom

ysaGItfYlX0nbIaRLpKi7g.text: Really good fish and chips.  We had both the Halibut and cod, perfectly fried and batter was quite good. Daughter says her chicken nuggets were just like McDonalds which to her is about as high of a compliment possible.

98QVQYbUaac6sDTman26yg.text: I'm so glad I waited this long to enjoy fish and chips properly . This place crushed it . Simply said , diamond in the rough!! Love love this place

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom

8p7R7LMAq-CGQSheXbxoaQ.text: Food was Great hot and fresh last bite as good as the first!!  Wait staff was friendly.  Only negative no AC probably not an issue 10 months out of the year.  If you want a local feel and a great meal check them out!!!

C80IwSiz26pgRzfiWzKSOQ.text: Ugly interior, not the kindest persons to cater to service and a somewhat dingy when coming to sallads and stuff. And it's pricey. £9-10 for fried fish and a lot of fries. Fish is good, but you kinda feel that you want more. Mayonnaise in a smal plastic container? What the heck?Nah thanks. I've eaten fish and chips waaaay better than this in New Zealand. For half the price.If it was cheap? Sure, I'd recommend you trying it yourself, but as it is now.. just don't.

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. This is not. For 9-10. Not worth it.

l--DTPmcNSpx9XMQburBQw.text: Yummy and good for a quick bite in London! The fish is kind of plain but there are a lot of sauces on the table. I've had better fries
