RlR5_qwjHP8AOZSkLNQF6Q.text: The rock fish and chips rock. Very succulent and tender. Would highly recommend this though the restaurant is called "The Laughing Halibut."

rGE89N0Ec_vLPOVCI3tNOg.text: We've tried at least 3 other fish and chips places prior to coming here. The place was nothing fancy but it was full so a good sign. The fried halibut was pricier and came out in a thick but smaller piece, than the usual cod, but was crunchy outside,  flaky inside, and not oily.  Very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom

MclintkqQYJEiSkWsXw26g.text: Delicious fish and chips. HUGE portions. Friendly and helpful staff and great location. Loved it!

288-e1bwIRdVfyj8FqCBQg.text: Solid 4 star. Go for the cod not the halibut. The cod is more juicy and a huge portion. Halibut was a bit dry. All the locals we eating cod, now I know why.

yUo7EcRNA2mqJc8D8ZES3w.text: Amazing fish&chips experience!!! I'm highly recommend you this place if you want to try nice halibut!

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom

V1cTVIFoOdozmJX4SSKsDA.text: I was expecting to be wowed by the quality and taste at this establishment but unfortunately they fell way short. The fish tasted like batter fried in old oil. Did not enjoy my meal at all.

uxspHrmVeibad8zYuYc9Og.text: Hey, it's Fish and chips from a shot-gun restaurant. The staff was nice and it tasted fine. There was a mix of locals in pants that were cuffed too high and confused tourists. The pies are just pre-packaged, but the fried stuff is good.

uNN0HSBvwIE4Ua3q50gQSA.text: This is what a chippy should be- no frills, quick and efficient, and solid quality fish and chips. Bonus is the free wifi with password on the wall. This place was very clean so don't let outside appearances sway you. We came here after a walking tour that ended relatively close by. There was a full lunch crowd, mostly local it seemed. My only complaint would be pricing- a little steep compared to a (IMO) chippy I also visited that had similar quality product. And by no frills I mean tarter and mayonnaise in packets- yeah not fancy. But I will say the haddock I received was a tremendous portion and was crispy on the outside while being flakey on the inside. The chips were piping hot, but, flavorless, which I found at other London joints-definitely not like the Netherlands and Belgium. My husband had a breakfast dish- an over medium egg, pork sausage, and chips. The pork sausage was good- flavorful, cooked well. The hot lemon tea was warming on the gloomy London day. Pay at the register after you're finished. I'd definitely return here again if I wanted a good meal in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. Haddock and chips

31e6g5KZnf83_l8eP30Ymg.text: This might look like an unassuming chip shop, but that's what you actually want. Authentic, filling, delicious. Is low key, but they take pride in their work and it shows. Not greasy, not healthy, just golden perfection. The cook even took time out to boast about his craft.They serve Irn Bru; that might be a pro or con for you, but it won't diminish how the haddock tastes.

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom

QBoWQRpqMTJmOZsCiYYEYA.text: Awesome cod and chips. Would go here again. Huge portion as well. The cod was perfectly breaded and cooked, moist inside, crispy outside, with a Buttery batter.  The chips/fries were really nice as well, quite tasty, crispy, but soft center. Hey friendly service as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom

Zw4qGHFqWc9TwfknfW9A0g.text: it was our last meal in London and we wanted fish and chips, got onto the Yelp app and found Laughing Halibut, it states it's the best traditional British fish & chip, so we thought ok, lets give them a try.I went with the large cod & chips. The fish was perfectly fried, didn't have an over fried taste to it, it was light and crispy, the fish was nice and tender, just perfectly cooked, the chips where good too, really didn't go wrong ordering this dish.The restaurant is plain and has a handful of tables, and it was packed even though it was less than an hour away from closing, and if you do not want to dine there, they do offer take away.Next time I'll have to try the halibut!

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom

eotaNmE5PZRmJXu_SDbzWQ.text: Standard, classic, fish and chips that will satisfy the tourists and seems to be a favorite of locals as well. The cod and halibut are both flaky, crispy, and burn-your-tongue-hot, so be careful. It's hard to believe you aren't eating the entire fish, the portions are so large. Fries are alright, and the vinegar here isn't really that sour. But other than that, can't go wrong here!

8J9VSzDH-OMUUZixpspIzQ.text: I wanted the best of the best in terms of fish and chips to try since it was my first time in London, so after some Yelp reviews, I decided to go to the Laughing Halibut.  It was good.  Initially it was a bit bland but the server taught me to add the vinegar and a sprinkling of salt.  It made a huge difference. Service was great and the portion was so large that walked out full and with left overs.

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom

XkqP__TrNXWU_9--bQ9u5g.text: I mean if you're looking for cheap fish and chips this is the place to go. It's nothing upscale or nice. Just casual and small dine in. I don't particularly love it because it's mostly fried food, but since the price was fair, especially for london, I'm giving it 4 stars. The cod fish was fresh and the fries were normal. The service was nice and fast. If you're looking for a quick stop in the UK for fish and chips this is perfect.

qHFT4jIIv7coPQaoa9T5aA.text: Wow! This restaurant looks like a hole in the wall and I was skeptical when I walked in but boy was I wrong! The service was swift and the fish n chips were breaded by hand to order. The fish and chips were super hot when it arrived to our table. I had the cod with a curry dipping sauce. The sauce was spicy and delicious! I used it for my fish AND chips. A little splash of malt vinegar here and there completed a wonderful dish. Prices were reasonable for the portion sizes. Excellent choice!

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. Cod fish n chips with curry sauce

-_nZiRalyQC6OrDijh_7FQ.text: Really good fish and chips! I would highly recommend it. I ordered the regular cod version and was amazed at how well the fish was done.In terms of service, it was OK. It was around 6:30 when we went and they seemed anxious to close. At around 7:15, they almost turned someone away from sitting at the restaurant until the customers promised they'd be done before closing. So, they didn't seem very customer focused.However, if you're in the area, I would recommend this place! The food is delicious and not too expensive.

Rb7F739KcD3cBj7hujUFpQ.text: A total fluke that we picked this place. We were planning on going to Paddington to have fish and chips at Micky's due to their amazing reputation. But we were tired and stopped here. It is an unassuming little place with take out and table service. We took a seat and the waiter took our order. He was pleasant and kind. We ordered Haddock and Cod with chips. It took about ten minutes and the fish was huge with a large side of fries. This was the best out of the seven places I tried on the trip. It was perfectly cooked, flavourful and moist.

ziyfhK8ShFNdox-A4sPDyw.text: We ordered the Halibut and it must of been made to order because everyone else who ordered Cod got theirs way before us. When we got our food it was good but not great. The piece of fish was too thick in my opinion. The biggest downside to me was the fact that they use packets of Tatar sauce. I think if your a fish place you should make your own. You have the option here to take out or sit in. The restaurant portion is way to small for how many people come in during lunch. I would try a few more places before going back.

1tP5ov8ye126oEBGGh3wGA.text: Can't say enough about this place! Reasonably priced for Cod and Chips (10.50 pounds) with great service. Very chill place and you can share the cod and chips between two people easily!

IRgL4jHYxoMvd3n_mjI1EA.text: Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)1/1 Star: walked here. No wait to get a seat._____Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)1/1 Star: service was normal, clean tables, simple ambiance._____Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)1/3 Stars: fish and chips were edible, but there wasn't any flavor. Just tasted like fried food.  There was more flavor in the fries than the fish._____Overall Experience3/5 Stars _____Last WordsThis was my first fish and chips in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom

uJFD0hR-48eTsQFC_y_sNg.text: First fish and chips for us..  Good experience. Freshly fried for us.  Friendly people..

_Z1RJjJqr7CmP_R92qCvpA.text: Not bad, but I've had better (outside of UK).Decor was modest, front staff gents were super nice and friendly... waitress a little less so.  after I described to the waitress that I didn't really like dry/firm fish....she recommended the halibut and chips...but that's what I got..dry/thick and firm. So i think she recommended the wrong thing. Our table also ordered the Cornish pasty, which was good...but again, not terrific. The fish itself was fried perfectly tho...not at all greasy, and the fries were ok...both were just a little bland. Even with vinegar and salt.  Wouldn't recommend the gravy either...just nothing special about it. Ok if you're in the area, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it

xpiarFiP5utNlx1OduWhwA.text: Cool place to eat the quintessential British meal of Fish & Chips! Busy place, so food is always fresh! Staff is quick, attentive and keep the flow going!

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. My son approves!!
Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. My plate!!
Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom

cqdYDtXzJ0oWcSQnWdw2gw.text: We had a 24-hour layover in London and decided to hit the town for some classic Fish and Chips. This place is no frills and very unpretentious. The food was delicious and the staff was friendly and engaging. The food was delicious and affordable. The kids left no chip behind. I highly recommend this place for people who want the Fish and Chips experience done right. An added bonus is the location. It is only a 12-minute walk to Westminster. I'm sure we will be back.

m9v29cGkCRRoGx92eyelAQ.text: Absolutely delicious fish/calamari and chips. Highly recommend making this one of your stops in London. Very friendly staff!

OwbU6HMEp3OVWUBfIvz1Rw.text: Absolutely wonderful! If you're looking for a perfect example of what fish & chips should be, there's a reason this place is so highly rated and recommended. Also, their other offerings are great; I'm an American and fan of diners, and the cheeseburger I had was great. Waitstaff is also great. Be warned this place is often very busy, especially Fridays, but don't let the potential crowd put you off.

yDl2wkDWY0mX4YPXMLTsjQ.text: My bf and just arrived to london and came across this place. Food was great not as greasy as you would think. Later we found out by our Airbnb host that this is the best place to have fish and chips, good quality and affordable. Highly recommend this place.Service was great everyone was very nice and welcoming.

WDr9NoEyIkuT469paiVwPg.text: Better-than-average fish & chips joint, with lots of fish choices, and other items too (chicken, sausages, pies). However, at the end of the day, fish & chips is still...fish & chips. The halibut is 50% more expensive than the other fishes, yet I prefer the cod which is more moist. They cook your fish on order, so the wait was incredibly long.

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. One is cod, the other halibut.
Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom

3ihlkIg4nmIae-8V5wVN8w.text: large portions of fish and chips, food is great.  the staff are very friendly and helpful.  if this place was closer to our hotel we would have gone several times.  but we did go the last time we were in London two summers ago so we're repeat customers.

EWnh-RcXY7mh77JbEXAKpw.text: Great haddock and chips. Everyone is friendly and food cooked perfectly. Definitely coming back here again.

leJwyrRmmre5WyNORC1vbQ.text: This is a top notch "old school" fish & chip shop (surprisingly hard to find in London) much loved by the folk who have the good fortune to live or work in the area.It's very popular for a take away at lunch time with queues out the door most of the time but don't let that put you off - these guys are quick and efficient so you will rarely wait more than 10 minutes for your fishy feast. If you don't fancy eating fish & chips in the street, the nearby park or at a desk in the office there is a sit down option in the "restaurant" at the back of the shop which has plenty of seating (walk in past the queue outside and you will be found somewhere to perch).The fish is fresh and has plenty of flavour. The crisp golden batter keeps it nice and moist and when teamed up with a small portion of perfectly cooked chips this is a British classic which will leave you stuffed and well satisfied for under £7 (if you are not famished a portion between two might suffice). I'm a haddock man myself but if you want something a little more adventurous there is skate and calamari on the menu as well as an array of chicken, burgers, sausages and pies.If you are hungry in the Westminster area and fancy a taste of quality traditional British "street" food then you could do a lot worse than join the queue at The Laughing Halibut.

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. The Laughing Halibut

SPyb6UnLa4w2G1k_OB5OJQ.text: The absolute best Fish and Chips in London ! I tried many and I have to admit this one must absolutely be one of the best !Choose your fish and the way you like it, the perfect sauce that may fit it and let's go for a incredible journey in paradise !Great place to discover again and again !

T3sK2IpBEHMi_CLrWDxVXg.text: Slightly more expensive than other places but good. Freshly cooked on the spot I think

ipG4-R6grX73Le0wV95FLw.text: The chips..ah, yes the chips. Quite simply they are the best chips this side of the Mason Dixon Line (wherever that may be). Go there without delay....

IjyZro5YVLatZrSssAmapw.text: Good spot to grab some fish n chips. The meal itself is basic but the fish is of good quality. I got the haddock and chips which was recommended by the server. Get the fish n chips with curry sauce - really good compliment. Service was great too!

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. Haddock and chips with curry sauce

oAJq8HxdGGro348ALQzGIg.text: Visit London on a regular basis and make this a stop every time. Super friendly staff and very good traditional fish and chips. I'll be back next time I visit London.

DlGA965-B_Fr4gPpS4X5bA.text: Fish and chips were 5-star quality. Docking 1-star as they didn't have malt vinegar, only some variation of it that contained artificial ingredients. The restaurant was on the warm side and the water was served without ice due to this. Normally isn't an issue for me, but after a few miles of walking I was craving some ice cold water.

2gSWV7gcsiNDXUNnSiHO7A.text: If you're looking for that authentic taste of English Fish & Chips, look no further. This is your local "Chippie". Decent prices, great staff. There isn't much more to say. I strongly recommend it!

kzsBGa5_khNY0flaDS-yFg.text: I went here and I will say that it is very good and far above average.  The service was very fast, I want to say less than 5 minutes from order (haddock & chips) to it being on my table ready to eat.  The chips were good too.  And for £8 it was a great value.I will say this ranks in the top 5 places I've had fish & chips, anywhere.

av958cmnSAMu-Q70pIS3fQ.text: Awesome Fish & Chips.  Food was delivered quickly, and was quite tasty.  Got the Haddock & Chips, and a Ginger Beer.  I'll be going back.

eVdrkoQMrUzkhC9q7aLzjA.text: Came here based on Yelp reviews. Got haddock and chips and my wife got cod and chips. Both were very fresh and tasty.  Definitely recommend.

_02W2680Ot5vWhXMo51iUQ.text: Cod made to perfection. Crispy on the outside, ever so tender on the inside. The chips are just like they should be. Add some salt and vinegar and you are in heaven. A chippy just the way it should be!Eat in if you manage to get a Table :).

LOEpwyjOZg8htMkeaKffaQ.text: Great service. Fair prices. Delicious shandy and ginger beer. My sisters devoured their cod and chips, but my stepmother wasn't too thrilled with her haddock (too much bread/not enough meat)...And for all of my fellow vegetarians out there: The chili bean burger definitely hit the spot after an afternoon of touristing!

G4CiCpk3A9YC7RCnGPMKVw.text: absolutely loved the food here. best fish and chips we had in London. husband raved about them, and he is a fish and chips connoisseur. their 'to-go' bagging could use some work - no container, just fish and fries straight into the paper bag, so hard to eat if you're not somewhere with plates.

1PaBc0KMbNnyv__4G_R1Ew.text: Good and casual right by parliament and Westminster...  very informal and gets pretty packed.  Haddock and Cod were fresh and wonderful.  Definitely a stop for a quick fish and chips.

3iADcbeHX3AOOQ7sBKm7jQ.text: The fish and chips are probably the best I've had in London, but the service is painfully slow. I have waited over half an hour at lunch time for takeaway. Don't get a chip butty. The bread is crusty rather than squishy and doughy.

bubQFEmWcYBBXtP_4Midiw.text: We were out and about and starving when we came across this restaurant-rich neighborhood. We liked the name, so in we went!The piece of cod I had was huge, nicely battered, properly fried and very tasty. Matching them were nice, thick, not-too-crispy chips that allowed the potato flavor to come through loud and clear.My wife is not a f&c fan, so she went with the Beef & Onion Pie. She's not really a pie fan either (she was just going along), but she wiped out the whole thing. She's still not a huge fan of the pie concept, though maybe she's being won over.Real fish and chips shops that don't seem to prefer to traffic in kabobs are difficult to find in London, these days, so The Laughing Halibut is a great destination for sampling the form.

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. Beef and onion pie, and chips
Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. Fish and chips. Cod, in this instance.

bwhSyw4-j79q4zn35erfzQ.text: I stumbled onto this place back in 2007 on my first trip to London. After one huge portion of fish which was fried to perfection, and for a cheap price too, I was completely hooked! Since then I've been coming back every few years. I think it says a lot that over 7 years total the Laughing Halibut is still the same great place with excellent food and excellent, friendly service.

LyMjDxUxCZiLd5oHOL8nOg.text: One of the best fish and chip shops in London. Perfect chips - made from scratch with actual potatoes (I've seen the delivery arrive!) - and both the quality of the menu on the eat in and counter sides are terrific.I'm not a big fan of fish, but even I love it here - the little battered fish goujons/pieces are terrific and my friends love the cod and halibut.

5BkxiBlz9KXR8c_HzK-IKg.text: Enjoyed the best haddock I've had in a long time here.  Portion was huge! Twice the size I've received from other shops.  One order could easily feed two people.  Batter is crisp and well seasoned. Chips were cooked perfectly and a large portion given.  The two teas we ordered with our meals came piping hot just the way I like it.  Staff we dealt with were engaging and attentive. Prices were cheap considering the amount of food given.  We would definitely return.

RChbEdP2PwROmvvAOkwakA.text: Very near perfect fish and chips, served in a nice restaurant (or to take away while you wander around Westminster) is sometimes just what you need. They're happy to fry from fresh if you ask, and the chips are some of the best "chunky" - proper - ones around.Friday is a very busy day, especially at lunch. On other days it's hard to not be tempted by the other food stalls lining Strutton Ground to cater to the huge office populous, but the trip is worth it.To top it all off, there's a list of famous (and otherwise) people who've eaten here. You should join them.

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. Does what it says on the sign.

cDgyZmkzJZQvLFndaOdmog.text: The most important part of a fish and chips meal is the fish. I was disappointed with what I got here. The fish was covered with way too much batter and it was overcooked. When taking a bite, the batter was more obvious than the fish itself. This is not a good indicator. It felt too oily and I discarded it before I had had half of it. The fish itself was too flaky and had little substance. It may be because it was overcooked, or it may be the nature of my choice of fish (I had the plaice).The chips that came with the fish were fine and you got plenty for the price you paid. A school kid looking for an after school treat could do worse. However, I overheard there being a minimum charge of £5, so you wouldn't be getting chips on their own.

JLWbuYUfpdF7PeC_5qvxQw.text: Very solid local fish n chips joint. The haddock was delicious, cod was not quite as good but still above average. Chips were golden and fluffy. It's quite popular during lunch time. Service is very efficient. Nice to have such a place near my flat.

p-E6fspFdGK5fAxNC5nMjA.text: Delicious! The chips were fried to perfection and the cod had a perfect layer of batter. Definitely one of the best stops I made in all of London, and handily beat the fish n chips I had in Dublin. We got there around 5 and by 5:30 every seat was taken! Good thing that they also do takeout.Prices are very reasonable and the serving size was huge! Will definitely be back if I'm ever on this side of the Atlantic.

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. Front of restaurant

83boqh9qsf1Hz2n9krzePw.text: Not bad. Fish is of good quality! Fresh and hot perfectly fried but I have it 3 stars because the tarter sauce comes out a packet. I think they should have a better quality tarter for the fish. Here is also no ice for your drinks. My "cold" soda was actually warm.

ZJigvYCi3L-LYmHpiEkVag.text: Probably the best fish and chips in central London. You won't go wrong here as the prices are good, the service is fast, and the Haddock in particular is amazing!

RepCkK8FO2dXPeyyXFpCLw.text: I'm happy that I came here! They seem to be the only place that serves halibut still. They serve other types of fish as well. An added bonus for me is they also had Dr. Pepper which you can't find anywhere in Europe or the UK. If I'm wrong, please tell me otherwise.  The fish was delicious!

pzQeM7ZD7wu-Z-_HGyateA.text: Yes, go.  I had 2 hours to spend in central London between my flight into Heathrow and our of London City.  I'm glad I ate here.  Fish was firm, fresh and had great taste.  Service was friendly and fast.

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. Halibut and chips with a shandy.

f1KiAYURyKnWPokjN5cZWw.text: Great and huge cod Nice chips.  Everything is fresh and delicious. If you are not very hngry it is better to share your fish'n'chips cause the protions are huge.

IWxohDDd7xUsAFaYT8j9dA.text: I tried to find 'fish & chips' as my last dinner before leaving London because I know it is typical British-style.So busy on the majority of British restaurant & bars around 6pm.I found it and tried.Good though nothing special,I mean typical cod & chips.They are served within only 1 min I suppose cause they keep frying fresh fish and chips all the time (so many people).It's like family mode bar and nice persons.The price is great.10pounds for cod,chips and a glass of ice lemon tea.

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. fish & chips

GWA-0W46JhAd7bAOCl-ivg.text: Quick, delicious and efficient describe my experience.  We came for a late lunch after reading the reviews.  We sat down and were greeted by our server who helped us decide between the cod and the haddock; I ordered the cod, my wife chose the haddock.  But it didn't really matter because both came within 5 minutes and were equally delicious.  The regular serving is a generous piece of fish, lightly coated and deep fried to crispy perfection joined on the plate with a large serving of fries.  This meal is larger than our usual order of 'Friday fish fry'; I loved every bite and I know you will too.  It's a short walk from the St James Park tube stop but we walked off our meal by heading to the Westminster stop, past Westminister Abbey and Big Ben.

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. An afternoon late lunch
Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. One haddock and one cod regular dinner

pVdlCm1sOKh5q9_RRK-CVg.text: I used to go to school very near the Laughing Halibut. Every week on Wednesday my father would pick me up and I'd jump out of the car to get a quick takeaway of chips.I've been going for many years and I honestly think it's the best fish and chips shop I've ever been to.They also refurbished the restaurant a couple of years ago so the whole shop is much more appealing than before.It is a must!

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom

hNcQ6oBI3cMOTmaoLwKb8Q.text: Very Nice. Crunchy fish. The chips are not my thing. I come from belgium and i work in a chips shop so i am very picky. Still had a Nice meal for just a 10er.

dM1vWvWNH3CPM1MyRlVm1g.text: We want to this place since it was located on the same street as the apartment we rented. Our host recommended it as a good place for some real local fish and chips. The 2 waiters weren't very friendly but I think that's somewhat normal in the UK. They were out of halibut but we got cod and chips. The food was good (and greasy!). It's not something I could eat everyday but it seemed pretty authentic!

vzqI2HLLmcaUUjvxQWYbcA.text: Not a real high opinion of this place. The service lacked attention, the fish was dry (even the Halibut), and it really wasn't clean. I'm not to sure what they have going for them. After living two years in Australia, I really gained an appreciation for some good fish and chips. This was not it.

vjVAgHI6qyImc1cIRrUumg.text: The halibut is not laughing, he's dead, fried, & delicious. You know it's good when the Coffee place next door has a sign in front to not form a queue to block their entrance.  As a novice, I formed the queue not realizing that you can just go directly inside if you are not doing take away. My bad. Our friendly server recommended the haddock and cod. The women working here are awesome. Efficient and willing to cover each other to meet needs of the dining area. Genuinely smiling and hospitable. Fish was hot and crispy and once I squeezed the lemon wedge across the fish, our family dove right in. Mushy peas and gravy seemed to be a traditional favorite here so I jumped on that band wagon and added it to our Friday Fish Fry. I loved dipping my chips in the gravy which was thick and savory. Great place for the best fish and chips in London, if you are like me checking off a foodie list.

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. Haddock comes out faster than your water. Service is excellent here.

Mut5X0rIEqDrwsnjculunA.text: It's worth searching for this little jem of a shop.  Perfection for what it is.

cv9qSRYCVmPze46nr4upwg.text: I know nothing about British food but I am lucky enough to be here on business and while stumbling around in a nauseated jet-lagged state, I realized part of my problem was hunger. It was probably fate that when I looked up, from my cell phone map, I was standing in front of this shop. I was suspicious at first since I was close to tourist ground zero but upon ducking inside, the place was full of locals (or at least a lot of people faking really good British accents) which I took as a good sign. Service is friendly and it seems to be run by a family with the patriarch manning the fryolator in a pristine white chef jacket. I was feeling better already. A plate of fried scampi and chips with a side of mushy peas later and all was right in the world. To be fair, this place gets 4 stars for what it is...an inexpensive chip shoppe with persons skilled in the art of frying food at a fair price with fast and friendly service. The 5th star is a miss for me at a place like this because the mayo and tartar sauces come in small packets from an industrial supplier (too generic) and their traditional pies are prepackaged from another industrial supplier. If they could make these things on premises, the 5th star would have been a given. Now if only they had a license to serve a proper pint, that would put them totally over the top!

photos.caption: Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. Scampi and chips with a side of mushy peas.
Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. Closest tube station
Photo of Laughing Halibut - London, United Kingdom. Proper condiments
